ids_info.name: real_time_data
ids_info.description: Description of the data bus circulating on the real time data network of the machine. This is typically used (but not only) as an interface to the Plasma Control System (PCS)

real_time_data/topic.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: real_time_data/topic
IDS: real_time_data
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 1
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: real_time_data
FIELD_NAME: topic
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: real_time_data -> topic

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: List of topics. Signals are grouped by topic

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[real_time_data]: Description of the data bus circulating on the real time data network of the machine. This is typically used (but not only) as an interface to the Plasma Control System (PCS)

FIELD_NAME: allocated_position
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: real_time_data -> topic -> signal -> allocated_position

real_time_data/topic/signal/quality.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: real_time_data/topic/signal/quality
IDS: real_time_data
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: real_time_data/topic/signal
FIELD_NAME: quality
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: real_time_data -> topic -> signal -> quality

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Indicator of the quality of the signal. Following ITER PCS documentation (https://user.iter.org/?uid=354SJ3&action=get_document), possible values are: 1 - GOOD (the nominal state); 2 - INVALID (data no usable); 3 - DATA INTEGRITY ERROR (e.g. out of bounds with respect to expectations, calibration error,...)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[real_time_data]: Description of the data bus circulating on the real time data network of the machine. This is typically used (but not only) as an interface to the Plasma Control System (PCS)
CONTAINER[real_time_data/topic]: List of topics. Signals are grouped by topic
CONTAINER[real_time_data/topic/signal]: List of signals that are allocated to the PCS interface
